Empowering the Next Generation

Impacting Futures Through Technology in Schools

Techimpacters brings high-quality tech education and resources to schools, bridging the digital divide for every student.

View Our ProjectsLearn More

Who We Are

An Academic NGO on a Mission to Transform Schools

Techimpacters was founded with a simple yet powerful goal: to ensure that every student, regardless of their background, has access to the tools and knowledge necessary to thrive in the digital age.

Quality Curriculum

Providing modern tech curriculum tailored for K-12 students.

Expert Mentors

Connecting students with industry professionals and tech enthusiasts.

Wide Reach

Partnering with schools in both urban and underserved communities.

Impact Focused

Dedicated to measurable growth in digital literacy and coding skills.

Read our full story →
10+

Years of Excellence in Tech Education

Our Projects

Driving Change Through Innovation

Explore our flagship initiatives designed to empower young students and educators with modern tools. From coding to robotics, we're making tech accessible to every child.

Digital Literacy

Code For Kids

A comprehensive program teaching basic programming to primary school students across 15 schools.

Infrastructure

Mobile Lab Initiative

Deploying portable computer labs to rural schools that lack permanent tech facilities.

Innovation

STEM Workshops

Interactive weekend workshops focusing on robotics and electronics for high school students.

Our Real-World Impact

Creating Sustainable Tech Ecosystems

We measure success by the number of young minds we empower. Every school we reach, every student we train, and every teacher we upskill brings us closer to a digitally inclusive future.

What's New

Latest Updates

Get involved
New
March 2026

Young Innovators Bootcamp 2026

Registration is now open for our annual 2-week summer program. 150 spots available for secondary school students.

Expansion
February 2026

Mobile Lab Expands to 5 New States

Our Mobile Lab Initiative is reaching more rural communities. 12 new schools will receive rotating computer labs.

Milestone
January 2026

Teacher Tech Certification Program

500+ educators certified in digital pedagogy. Our training program continues to grow across the region.
